net.dempsy.output

Interface OutputScheduler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CronOutputSchedule, RelativeOutputSchedule

    public interface OutputScheduler
extends Service
    This interface enables the client application to implement their own custom output scheduler and plug-in to Dempsy. Using this scheduler, client application will take responsibility to invoke the @output methods of MPs. During startup, Dempsy will provide an instance of OutputInvoker to the scheduler, and executes the start method to trigger the output schedule.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setOutputInvoker(OutputInvoker outputInvoker)
      This method will be called by Dempsy to provide the instance of outputInvoker.
      void start(Infrastructure infra)
      This method will be called by Dempsy to tell the OutputExecuter that it can begin executing the @Output methods of MPs with the OutputInvoker.
      void stop()
      This method will be called by Dempsy in order to get the OutputExecuter to stop executing @Output methods of MPs.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.dempsy.Service

        close, isReady

    • Method Detail

      • setOutputInvoker

        void setOutputInvoker(OutputInvoker outputInvoker)
        This method will be called by Dempsy to provide the instance of outputInvoker.
        Parameters:
        outputInvoker - the output invoker

      • start

        void start(Infrastructure infra)
        This method will be called by Dempsy to tell the OutputExecuter that it can begin executing the @Output methods of MPs with the OutputInvoker. #start() will always be called after #setOutputInvoker() . This method execution will be stopped, when stop() is called from Dempsy.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Service

      • stop

        void stop()
        This method will be called by Dempsy in order to get the OutputExecuter to stop executing @Output methods of MPs. Under normal circumstances the #start() is still executing and the stop() should cause the #start() to stop.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Service
